name: relink
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] to make a connection again between two or more people, things, or ideas, after a time when they were not connected: The scheme aims to relink citizens to their country. We need to relink wages and productivity.
[ T ] to connect two objects or places again physically: It took two years to relink the railway tracks. I unhooked and re-linked the couplings.
[ I or T ] to make a new connection with a website, social media post, video, etc. on the internet: I downloaded the new version from the internet and relinked the application to it. I had to relink the tables to get the database to work. Related word
link
More examplesFewer examplesThey are campaigning for the state pension to be relinked to earnings.Eventually the town was relinked to civilization.It may be necessary to relink the pictures after you install a patch.
